Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PAM1 (platypus antimicrobial 1, OranCath1; natural AMPs; cathelicidins; egg-laying mammals, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: The sequence was initially identified by Warren WG et al 2008 Nature 453:175-83).Activity: active against Gram- E. coli DH5alpha (MIC 0.75 uM), Sal. enterica ATCC 14028 (MIC 0.47 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 1.89 uM), Gram+ B. subtilis (MIC 1.96 uM), S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 0.56 uM), Strep. pyogenes ATCC 19615 (MIC 0.73 uM), Strep. uberis (MIC 0.25 uM), and fungi C-albicans ATCC 753 (MIC >20 uM).Updated 6/2024
Literature Information.Author: Wang J, Wong ES, Whitley JC, Li J, Stringer JM, Short KR, Renfree MB, Belov K, Cocks BG.2011
Literature Information.Title: Ancient antimicrobial peptides kill antibiotic-resistant pathogens: Australian mammals provide new options
